results.title: Melbourne (no. 4)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Several shots of daffodils in a park. Nice colour, long shots.

Section 2. Shots in a park near the Yarra looking towards the city.

Section 3. Shots of Fitzroy gardens, conservatory and Government House.

Section 4. Shots of large houses in Toorak.

Section 5. ANZAC day march in the city. Many people involved.

Section 3. Shots of Fitzroy gardens, conservatory and Government House.

Section 4. Shots of large houses in Toorak.

Section 5. ANZAC day march in the city. Many people involved.

results.title: Successful camerawork for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.
results.description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.
description_for_label: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.

results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
R.D. Laing discusses the city of Glasgow - “its commerce, industry, learning and people; its violence and tenderness and great warm-heartedness”.

results.title: Green Fingers: Planting Evergreens
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Planting Evergreens’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to correctly plant evergreen trees and shrubs in your garden, accompanied by a narrator explaining the method and techniques. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
results.description: Green Fingers was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.

The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.

results.title: Subway [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Francois Ruggieri, TFI Films, Gaumont-British Instructional, TSF Production and Les Films du Loup
results.brief_description: This strange combination of action, comedy, violence and suspense tells the story of a cool rebel on the run, who uses the dark tunnels of the Paris subway as his hideout. There he meets a wide assortment of unusual characters. Stars Christopher Lambert and Isabelle Adjani. The soundtrack has been dubbed into English.

results.title: George Plimpton's New York
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
George Plimpton takes an overall look at the life in New York. From buildings and bridges, beauty and decay, wealth and poverty, to the culture of the people who give the city life.

results.title: Tomatoes for Troops
results.creator_credit: Bob Harper, Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture. Film Unit and Jack Keane
results.brief_description:
This film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, is an example of propaganda for the war effort, encouraging farmers to grow tomatoes for the armed forces during the Second World War. The film includes footage of soldiers on the Kokoda Trail, and outlines the importance of vegetables for the armed forces in combat overseas.

The film takes the viewer through the stages of tomato production on a mass scale, showing the process of collecting, disinfecting and washing seeds; cultivating and fertilising the soil; planting the seedlings and maximising growth. The film then outlines common diseases and pests that threaten the healthy growth of tomato plants, such as spotted wilt, tomato moths and weevils, along with preventative measures to mitigate these risks.

Finally, the film shows the industrial-scale quality assessment and canning of tomatoes in a factory. The final product, shown in the hands of an active soldier, is a can of SPC peeled tomatoes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Harper, Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture. Film Unit and Jack Keane

The film takes the viewer through the stages of tomato production on a mass scale, showing the process of collecting, disinfecting and washing seeds; cultivating and fertilising the soil; planting the seedlings and maximising growth. The film then outlines common diseases and pests that threaten the healthy growth of tomato plants, such as spotted wilt, tomato moths and weevils, along with preventative measures to mitigate these risks.

Finally, the film shows the industrial-scale quality assessment and canning of tomatoes in a factory. The final product, shown in the hands of an active soldier, is a can of SPC peeled tomatoes.

The film includes footage of soldiers on the Kokoda Trail, and outlines the importance of vegetables for the armed forces in combat overseas.

The film takes the viewer through the stages of tomato production on a mass scale, showing the process of collecting, disinfecting and washing seeds; cultivating and fertilising the soil; planting the seedlings and maximising growth. The film then outlines common diseases and pests that threaten the healthy growth of tomato plants, such as spotted wilt, tomato moths and weevils, along with preventative measures to mitigate these risks.

Finally, the film shows the industrial-scale quality assessment and canning of tomatoes in a factory. The final product, shown in the hands of an active soldier, is a can of SPC peeled tomatoes.
